description: Fixed dead notes timing on 78 bar.
title: Dyers Eve

description: Tempo's now match the actual song perfectly. Completely redid guitar solo from scratch (it now matches the solo note for note, rhythm for rhythm, in all its sloppy glory). Guitar riff post solo was in wrong inversion (notes are on A+D string as parallel 4ths, not D+G string as parallel 5ths). Measure 116 is written in 15/16 since the second half of the measure is slightly shorter than the first half (the band comes in a hair early on the actual song, enough that changing the time signature makes sense, while leaving it in 4/4 would cause very weird spellings of notes)
title: Dyers Eve

description: fixed bass sound. Not sure how it got to synth bass. Now corrected to Picked bass
title: Dyers Eve

description: Revamped tempo of intro, as it is not a consistent beat=195. Guitars in intro fixed with correct palm muting. Fixed the intro drum fill. Guitar in measure 41 fixed (this is actually double tracked, not split into James and Kirk parts, but for the sake of hearing both, Kirk gets the pick slide). Having listened to the isolated guitar tracks, during "Dear Mother Dear Father", these are definitely 3-note power chords, not simple 2-note fifths. Swapped guitars in measure 150 and 151, now aligned with bass and drums which were correct. The "3-2-0" riff is not a pull-off, but is in fact palm-muted alternate picked. Corrected guitar transition in measure 156.
title: Dyers Eve

description:
Changed the main guitar riff to be 2-2-2-2 instead of 2-3-2-3.

Also changed measure 27 (and similar) to be palm-muted 8ths at the end instead of staccato-8ths (which the 16ths were previously - they were staccato-8ths in the file rather than palm-muted).
title: Dyers Eve
